Class Solution

  • java.lang.Object
    • Solution

  • public class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
    Solution is a data structure to store cubes. It represents a partial solution to the instant insanity problem. It portrays a pile of n cubes, where n is element of [1, 2, 3, 4].

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private static int numberOfCalls 
      private int size

      Constructors

      Solution(Solution other, Cube c)
      The constructor Cube(Color[] faces) is used to create a new cube with specific colours for its faces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solution

        public Solution(Cube[] cubes)
        The constructor Solution(Cube[] cube) is used to create a new solution with specific cubes for its instant insanity game. The array specifies the cubes in this solution.
        Parameters:
        Cube[] - cubes, Array of cubes in the game instant insanity for which you want the solution

      • Solution

        public Solution(Solution other,
                Cube c)
        The constructor Cube(Color[] faces) is used to create a new cube with specific colours for its faces. The array specifies the colours in the following order: up, front, right, back, left, and down. initializes this solution using the specified information. It receives a partial solution and a cube. The new solution has the same elements, in the same order, as the solution designated by other.
        Parameters:
        Solution - other, Cube C. That is partial and a cube that will be added to the game to find the valid solutions

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        retrieves size of the cube
        Returns:
        the number of cubes in the current solution

      • getCube

        public Cube getCube(int pos)
        retrieves a cube of the solution
        Returns:
        a cube in the current solution

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        returns whether or not the current solution is valid. checks each side of the stacks to see if each color is different
        Returns:
        boolean whether the current solution is valid or not

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Cube next)
        returns whether or not the current solution is valid. checks each side of the stacks to see if each color is different (creates new solution with the cube then does normal isvalid and then returns that)
        Parameters:
        Cube - next, Cube for which you want to add to the current solution
        Returns:
        boolean whether the current solution is valid or not

      • getNumberOfCalls

        public int getNumberOfCalls()
        retrieves the numberOfCalls for isValid
        Returns:
        the numberOfcalls to isValid

      • resetNumberOfCalls

        public void resetNumberOfCalls()
        resets the numberOfCalls for isValid ie turns it to 0
